nexttext:
We say that two morphisms $u:M\to N$ and $v:N\to M$ of involutive $A$-bimodules are \index{Homotopy equivalence} \textit{homotopy equivalent} if $u\circ v\sim {\operatorname{Id}}_N$ and $v\circ u\sim {\operatorname{Id}}_M$.


\section{The involutive tensor product} 


For an involutive $A_\infty$-algebra $A$ 

and involutive $A$-bimodules $M$ and $N$, the involutive tensor product $M\widetilde{\boxtimes}_\infty N$ is the following object in ${\operatorname{\mathpzc{iVect}}}_{{\operatorname{\mathbb{K}}}}$:
mathml: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex17.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="f-g=b^{N}\circ h+h\circ b^{M}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>g</mi></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mrow><msup><mi>b</mi><mi>N</mi></msup><mo>∘</mo><mi>h</mi></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mi>h</mi><mo>∘</mo><msup><mi>b</mi><mi>M</mi></msup></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

prevtext:
We say that two morphisms $u:M\to N$ and $v:N\to M$ of involutive $A$-bimodules are \index{Homotopy equivalence} \textit{homotopy equivalent} if $u\circ v\sim {\operatorname{Id}}_N$ and $v\circ u\sim {\operatorname{Id}}_M$.


\section{The involutive tensor product} 


For an involutive $A_\infty$-algebra $A$ 

and involutive $A$-bimodules $M$ and $N$, the involutive tensor product $M\widetilde{\boxtimes}_\infty N$ is the following object in ${\operatorname{\mathpzc{iVect}}}_{{\operatorname{\mathbb{K}}}}$:
text: $$M\widetilde{\boxtimes}_\infty N:=\frac{M\otimes_{{\operatorname{\mathbb{K}}}} {\operatorname{Bar}}(A)\otimes_{{\operatorname{\mathbb{K}}}} N}{(m^\star\otimes a_1\otimes\dots \otimes a_k\otimes n-m\otimes a_1\otimes\dots \otimes a_k\otimes n^\star)}.$$
